section.section:
Consent of a parent may include a waiver of the right to notice of:
the filing of a petition under this subtitle; and
further proceedings under this subtitle.
Subject to paragraph (2) of this subsection, a person may revoke consent to guardianship at any time within 30 days after the person signs the consent.

A parent may not revoke consent for guardianship of a child if:
in the preceding year, the parent has revoked consent for or filed a notice of objection to guardianship of the child; and
the child is at least 30 days old and consent is given before a judge on the record.
